lexUnit.name: pull on.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: put on (an item of clothing)

sentence.text: She pulled on her shawl and moved quickly to the door .
He pulled the shirt on but made no effort to button it .
Because the room was so cold he had pulled on his bomber jacket over his father 's shirt .
She got up , showered quickly , and pulled on her clothes .
Rab pulled on his trousers .
Duncan had pulled on his trousers and gone into the hallway .
Jane pulled on her trousers and tied the drawstring .
They pulled on jeans and jumpers , had a hasty breakfast , tipped their clothes into their cases , then scuttled through the dripping trees to the pea-green Polo .
Lizzy pulled on her underwear and jeans .
She pulled on her towelling bathrobe and slid her feet into a pair of sandals .
I watched her pulling on leggings and splashing in .
Vi swung her respirator on to her left shoulder and pulled on her navy-blue woollen gloves .
He had pulled on his fur-lined parka ready to brave the elements .
Upstairs Henry propped the leg in a corner of the attic and pulled his pyjamas on .
I pulled on my pyjamas over my other clothes , but without any beneficial effect …
The man pulled on a balaclava and ran past the girl into bushes at the end of the bridge .
Lisa slept like a stone in the big double bed -- far comfier than her own bed at home -- and awoke to find Emily already up and dressed , pulling on her green rubber wellies .

She pulled on a short silk nightdress -- a rather extravagant Christmas present from one of her sisters -- brushed her hair until the long dark strands gleamed , then walked slowly over to the window .
Marie pulls her boots on and says she 's going out to get some fags .
I love rugby and if I had the opportunity I would pull on my boots and play tomorrow .
In her room Phoebe pulled on her jeans and a shirt , and snatched up a thick pullover and the bottom half of her track suit for Maggie .
He had pulled on jeans but nothing else , and his shirtless state , bare feet and the fact that he had yet to shave gave him a vaguely disreputable appearance .
He pulled on the goggles but still there was nothing to see except for the red embers of a dying fire emanating from some unknown source .
Quickly she pulled on the breeches .
He pulled on his gauntlets , and picked up his helmet .
He pulled on his wet cap , adjusting it at an unusually rakish and dashing angle , and made his way , swaggering very slightly , to his comforts next door .
Mr Jarvis pulled on his cap .
Quite suddenly the temperature dropped and we pulled on sweaters , gloves , scarves and balaclavas .
